<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:6.5pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000732" name="us-gaap:LiabilitiesOtherThanLongtermDebtNoncurrent" contextRef="C_0000797721_20191231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">118,120</ix:nonFraction></p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1%; border-bottom:double 2.5pt transparent;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:6.5pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1.72%; border-bottom:double 2.5pt transparent;">
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:6.5pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1%; border-top:solid 0.75pt #000000; border-bottom:double 2.5pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:6.5pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">$</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:12.9%; border-top:solid 0.75pt #000000; border-bottom:double 2.5pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:6.5pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000733" name="us-gaap:LiabilitiesOtherThanLongtermDebtNoncurrent" contextRef="C_0000797721_20190331" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">120,826</ix:nonFraction></p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1%; border-bottom:double 2.5pt transparent;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:1pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
</tr>
</table></div>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;">&#160;</p></ix:nonNumeric></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">21</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">VIASAT, INC.</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(UNAUDITED)</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000396" name="us-gaap:FairValueDisclosuresTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000797721_20190401_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000396_dcnt_513b1dc5-5308-46e9-ae59-66b26197e520">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Note 3 &#8212; Fair Value Measurements </p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000424" name="us-gaap:FairValueOfFinancialInstrumentsPolicy" contextRef="C_0000797721_20190401_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000424_dcnt_970f3145-4e64-4507-a60f-73a165b088b9">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:4pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In accordance with the authoritative guidance for financial assets and liabilities measured at fair value on a recurring basis (ASC&#160;820), the Company determines fair value based on the exchange price that would be received for an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants, and prioritizes the inputs used to measure fair value from market-based assumptions to entity specific assumptions: </p>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:4.54%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="top" style="width:4.54%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#8226;</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Level&#160;1 &#8212; Inputs based on quoted market prices for identical assets or liabilities in active markets at the measurement date. </p></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:4.54%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="top" style="width:4.54%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#8226;</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Level&#160;2 &#8212; Observable inputs other than quoted prices included in Level&#160;1, such as quoted prices for similar assets and liabilities in active markets&#59; quoted prices for identical or similar assets and liabilities in markets that are not active&#59; or other inputs that are observable or can be corroborated by observable market data. </p></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:4.54%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="top" style="width:4.54%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#8226;</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Level&#160;3 &#8212; Inputs which reflect management&#8217;s best estimate of what market participants would use in pricing the asset or liability at the measurement date. The inputs are unobservable in the market and significant to the instrument&#8217;s valuation. </p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company had $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000753" name="us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsFairValueDisclosure" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapFairValueByFairValueHierarchyLevelAxis_us-gaapFairValueInputsLevel1Member_us-gaapFairValueByMeasurementFrequencyAxis_us-gaapFairValueMeasurementsRecurringMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000754" name="us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsFairValueDisclosure" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapFairValueByFairValueHierarchyLevelAxis_us-gaapFairValueInputsLevel1Member_us-gaapFairValueByMeasurementFrequencyAxis_us-gaapFairValueMeasurementsRecurringMember_20190331" decimals="-5" scale="6">5.0</ix:nonFraction></ix:nonFraction> million in cash equivalents (Level 1) and <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000751" name="us-gaap:AssetsFairValueDisclosure" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapFairValueByMeasurementFrequencyAxis_us-gaapFairValueMeasurementsRecurringMember_20191231" decimals="INF" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000752" name="us-gaap:AssetsFairValueDisclosure" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapFairValueByMeasurementFrequencyAxis_us-gaapFairValueMeasurementsRecurringMember_20190331" decimals="INF" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">no</ix:nonFraction></ix:nonFraction> assets measured at fair value on a recurring basis as of December 31, 2019 and March 31, 2019, respectively. The Company had an insignificant amount of foreign currency forward contract liabilities (Level 2) measured at fair value on a recurring basis as of December&#160;31, 2019 and March&#160;31, 2019. </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The following section describes the valuation methodologies the Company uses to measure financial instruments at fair value: </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Cash equivalents <span style="font-style:normal;">&#8212; The Company&#8217;s cash equivalents consist of money market funds. Money market funds are valued using quoted prices for identical assets in an active market with sufficient volume and frequency of transactions (Level&#160;1). </span></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Foreign currency forward contracts <span style="font-style:normal;">&#8212; The Company uses derivative financial instruments to manage foreign currency risk relating to foreign exchange rates. The Company does not use these instruments for speculative or trading purposes. The Company&#8217;s objective is to reduce the risk to earnings and cash flows associated with changes in foreign currency exchange rates. Derivative instruments are recognized as either assets or liabilities in the accompanying condensed consolidated financial statements and are measured at fair value. Gains and losses resulting from changes in the fair values of those derivative instruments are recorded to earnings or other comprehensive income (loss) depending on the use of the derivative instrument and whether it qualifies for hedge accounting. The Company&#8217;s foreign currency forward contracts are valued using standard calculations/models that are primarily based on observable inputs, such as foreign currency exchange rates, or can be corroborated by observable market data (Level&#160;2). </span></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Long-term debt <span style="font-style:normal;">&#8212; The Company&#8217;s long-term debt consists of borrowings under its Revolving Credit Facility and Ex-Im Credit Facility (collectively, the Credit Facilities), finance lease obligations reported at the present value of future minimum lease payments with current accrued interest, as well as $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000755" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentFaceAmount" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatTwoThousandAndTwentyFiveNotesMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">700.0</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million in aggregate principal amount of 2025 Notes and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000756" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentFaceAmount" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatTwoThousandAndTwentySevenNotesMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">600.0</ix:nonFraction> million in aggregate principal amount of 2027 Notes. Long-term debt related to the Revolving Credit Facility is reported at the outstanding principal amount of borrowings, while long-term debt related to the Ex-Im Credit Facility, 2025 Notes and 2027 Notes is reported at amortized cost. However, for disclosure purposes, the Company is required to measure the fair value of outstanding debt on a recurring basis. As of December&#160;31, 2019 and March&#160;31, 2019, the estimated fair value of the Company&#8217;s outstanding long-term debt related to the 2025 Notes was determined based on actual or estimated bids and offers for the 2025 Notes in an over-the-counter market (Level 2) and was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000757" name="us-gaap:LongTermDebtFairValue" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapFairValueByFairValueHierarchyLevelAxis_us-gaapFairValueInputsLevel2Member_us-gaapFairValueByMeasurementFrequencyAxis_us-gaapFairValueMeasurementsRecurringMember_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatTwoThousandAndTwentyFiveNotesMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">721.0</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000758" name="us-gaap:LongTermDebtFairValue" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapFairValueByFairValueHierarchyLevelAxis_us-gaapFairValueInputsLevel2Member_us-gaapFairValueByMeasurementFrequencyAxis_us-gaapFairValueMeasurementsRecurringMember_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatTwoThousandAndTwentyFiveNotesMember_20190331" decimals="-5" scale="6">670.3</ix:nonFraction> million, respectively. As of December&#160;31, 2019, the estimated fair value of the Company&#8217;s outstanding long-term debt related to the 2027 Notes was determined based on actual or estimated bids and offers for the 2027 Notes in an over-the-counter market (Level 2) and was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000759" name="us-gaap:LongTermDebtFairValue" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapFairValueByFairValueHierarchyLevelAxis_us-gaapFairValueInputsLevel2Member_us-gaapFairValueByMeasurementFrequencyAxis_us-gaapFairValueMeasurementsRecurringMember_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatTwoThousandAndTwentySevenNotesMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">641.9</ix:nonFraction> million. The fair value of the Company&#8217;s outstanding long-term debt as of March 31, 2019 related to the 2027 Notes approximated its carrying amount due to the proximity of the closing of the 2027 Notes compared to the reporting date. The fair value of the Company&#8217;s long-term debt related to the Revolving Credit Facility approximates its carrying amount due to its variable interest rate, which approximates a market interest rate. As of December&#160;31, 2019 and March&#160;31, 2019, the fair value of the Company&#8217;s long-term debt related to the Ex-Im Credit Facility was determined based on a discounted cash flow analysis using observable market interest rates for instruments with similar terms (Level 2) and was approximately $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000760" name="us-gaap:LongTermDebtFairValue" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapFairValueByFairValueHierarchyLevelAxis_us-gaapFairValueInputsLevel2Member_us-gaapFairValueByMeasurementFrequencyAxis_us-gaapFairValueMeasurementsRecurringMember_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatExportImportCreditFacilityMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">117.0</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000761" name="us-gaap:LongTermDebtFairValue" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapFairValueByFairValueHierarchyLevelAxis_us-gaapFairValueInputsLevel2Member_us-gaapFairValueByMeasurementFrequencyAxis_us-gaapFairValueMeasurementsRecurringMember_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatExportImportCreditFacilityMember_20190331" decimals="-5" scale="6">134.9</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million, respectively. The fair value of the Company&#8217;s finance lease obligations is estimated at their carrying value based on current rates (Level 2).</span> </p></ix:nonNumeric></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">22</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">VIASAT, INC.</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(UNAUDITED)</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000396_dcnt_513b1dc5-5308-46e9-ae59-66b26197e520"><ix:continuation id="F_000424_dcnt_970f3145-4e64-4507-a60f-73a165b088b9">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Satellite performance incentive obligations <span style="font-style:normal;">&#8212; The Company&#8217;s contracts with the manufacturers of the ViaSat-1 and ViaSat-2 satellites require the Company to make monthly in-orbit satellite performance incentive payments, including interest, through approximately fiscal year <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000762" name="vsat:LongTermPurchaseCommitmentExpirationYear" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongTermPurchaseCommitmentByCategoryOfItemPurchasedAxis_vsatSatellitePerformanceIncentivesObligationMember_us-gaapPropertyPlantAndEquipmentByTypeAxis_vsatSatellitesViasatOneAndViasatTwoMember_20190401_20191231">2028</ix:nonNumeric> subject to the continued satisfactory performance of the applicable satellites. The Company records the net present value of these expected future payments as a liability and as a component of the cost of the satellites. However, for disclosure purposes, the Company is required to measure the fair value of outstanding satellite performance incentive obligations on a recurring basis. The fair value of the Company&#8217;s outstanding satellite performance incentive obligations is estimated to approximate their carrying value based on current rates (Level 2). As of December&#160;31, 2019 and March&#160;31, 2019, the Company&#8217;s estimated satellite performance incentive obligations relating to the ViaSat-1 and ViaSat-2 satellites, including accrued interest, were $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000763" name="vsat:SatellitePerformanceIncentivesObligation" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapFairValueByFairValueHierarchyLevelAxis_us-gaapFairValueInputsLevel2Member_us-gaapFairValueByMeasurementFrequencyAxis_us-gaapFairValueMeasurementsRecurringMember_us-gaapLongTermPurchaseCommitmentByCategoryOfItemPurchasedAxis_vsatSatellitePerformanceIncentivesObligationMember_us-gaapPropertyPlantAndEquipmentByTypeAxis_vsatSatellitesViasatOneAndViasatTwoMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">27.9</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000764" name="vsat:SatellitePerformanceIncentivesObligation" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapFairValueByFairValueHierarchyLevelAxis_us-gaapFairValueInputsLevel2Member_us-gaapFairValueByMeasurementFrequencyAxis_us-gaapFairValueMeasurementsRecurringMember_us-gaapLongTermPurchaseCommitmentByCategoryOfItemPurchasedAxis_vsatSatellitePerformanceIncentivesObligationMember_us-gaapPropertyPlantAndEquipmentByTypeAxis_vsatSatellitesViasatOneAndViasatTwoMember_20190331" decimals="-5" scale="6">28.2</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million, respectively. </span></p></ix:continuation></ix:continuation><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000397" name="us-gaap:EarningsPerShareTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000797721_20190401_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:13pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Note 4 &#8212; Shares Used In Computing Diluted Net Income (Loss) Per Share </p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000433" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfWeightedAverageNumberOfSharesTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000797721_20190401_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:4.5pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:4.5pt;">&#160;</p>
<div>
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="margin:auto;border-collapse:collapse; width:90%;">
<tr>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:46.14%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt transparent;">
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;;font-size:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1.18%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt transparent;">
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td colspan="6" valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:24.72%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt #000000;">
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Three Months Ended</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1%;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:8pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:9pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Antidilutive shares excluded from the calculation for the three months ended December&#160;31, 2019 consisted of <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlishares" id="F_000776" name="us-gaap:AntidilutiveSecuritiesExcludedFromComputationOfEarningsPerShareAmount" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapAntidilutiveSecuritiesExcludedFromComputationOfEarningsPerShareByAntidilutiveSecuritiesAxis_us-gaapEmployeeStockOptionMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">489,293</ix:nonFraction> shares related to stock options (other than TSR performance stock options), <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlishares" id="F_000787" name="us-gaap:AntidilutiveSecuritiesExcludedFromComputationOfEarningsPerShareAmount" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapAntidilutiveSecuritiesExcludedFromComputationOfEarningsPerShareByAntidilutiveSecuritiesAxis_vsatTotalShareholderReturnPerformanceStockOptionMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1,086,737</ix:nonFraction> shares related to TSR performance stock options and <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlishares" id="F_000780" name="us-gaap:AntidilutiveSecuritiesExcludedFromComputationOfEarningsPerShareAmount" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapAntidilutiveSecuritiesExcludedFromComputationOfEarningsPerShareByAntidilutiveSecuritiesAxis_us-gaapRestrictedStockUnitsRSUMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">68,256</ix:nonFraction> shares related to restricted stock units. </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The weighted average number of shares used to calculate basic and diluted net loss per share attributable to Viasat, Inc. common stockholders is the same for the nine months ended December 31, 2019, and the three and nine months ended December 31, 2018, as the Company incurred a net loss attributable to Viasat, Inc. common stockholders for such periods and inclusion of potentially dilutive weighted average shares of common stock would be antidilutive. <hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">VIASAT, INC.</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(UNAUDITED)</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000398" name="us-gaap:GoodwillAndIntangibleAssetsDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000797721_20190401_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:4pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Note 5 &#8212; Goodwill and Acquired Intangible Assets </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:4pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">During the nine months ended December&#160;31, 2019, the increase in the Company&#8217;s goodwill related to the effects of foreign currency translation recorded within all three of the Company&#8217;s segments. During the nine months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018, the increase in the Company&#8217;s goodwill related to an insignificant acquisition, partially offset by the effects of foreign currency translation recorded within all three of the Company&#8217;s segments. </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000425" name="us-gaap:IntangibleAssetsFiniteLivedPolicy" contextRef="C_0000797721_20190401_20191231" escape="true">Other acquired intangible assets are amortized using the straight-line method over their estimated useful lives of <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000795" name="us-gaap:FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetUsefulLife" contextRef="C_0000797721_srtRangeAxis_srtMinimumMember_20190401_20191231" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen" continuedAt="C_969d49f7-0e11-4da3-adb7-64508766d438">two</ix:nonNumeric> to <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000796" name="us-gaap:FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetUsefulLife" contextRef="C_0000797721_srtRangeAxis_srtMaximumMember_20190401_20191231" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">ten<ix:continuation id="C_969d49f7-0e11-4da3-adb7-64508766d438"> years</ix:continuation></ix:nonNumeric>.</ix:nonNumeric> Amortization expense related to other acquired intangible assets was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000791" name="vsat:AmortizationOfAcquiredIntangibleAsset" contextRef="C_0000797721_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">1.9</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" December&#160;31, 2019 and 2018, respectively, and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000793" name="vsat:AmortizationOfAcquiredIntangibleAsset" contextRef="C_0000797721_20190401_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">5.9</ix:nonFraction> million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000794" name="vsat:AmortizationOfAcquiredIntangibleAsset" <p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The expected amortization expense of amortizable acquired intangible assets may change due to the effects of foreign currency fluctuations as a result of international businesses acquired. <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000434" name="us-gaap:ScheduleofFiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsFutureAmortizationExpenseTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000797721_20190401_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000434_cnt_1">Current and expected amortization expense for acquired intangible assets for each of the following periods is as follows:</ix:nonNumeric> </p><ix:continuation id="F_000434_cnt_1">

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;">&#160;</p></ix:continuation></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000399" name="vsat:LesseeOperatingAndFinanceLeasesDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000797721_20190401_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000399_dcnt_eed09ce1-43b4-494d-8c68-ebdc9a05341d">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:4pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Note 6 &#8211; Leases</p>
<p style="margin-top:4pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company&#8217;s operating leases consist primarily of leases for office space, data centers and satellite ground facilities and have remaining <span style="color:#000000;">terms from less than <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000805" name="vsat:OperatingLeaseRemainingLeaseTerm1" contextRef="C_0000797721_srtRangeAxis_srtMinimumMember_20190401_20191231" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">one year</ix:nonNumeric> to <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000806" name="vsat:OperatingLeaseRemainingLeaseTerm1" contextRef="C_0000797721_srtRangeAxis_srtMaximumMember_20190401_20191231" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">ten years</ix:nonNumeric>, <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000808" name="us-gaap:LesseeOperatingLeaseOptionToTerminate" contextRef="C_0000797721_20190401_20191231">s</ix:nonNumeric></span>ome of which include renewal options, and some of which include options to terminate the leases within one year. Certain earth station leases have renewal terms that have been deemed to be reasonably certain to be exercised and as such have been recognized as part of the Company&#8217;s right-of-use assets and lease liabilities. The Company&#8217;s lease <span style="color:#000000;">agreements do not contain any material residual value guarantees or material restrictive covenants. The Company recognized right-of-use assets and lease liabilities for such leases in connection with its adoption of ASC 842 as of April 1, 2019 (see Note 1 &#8212; Basis of Presentation &#8212; Leases for more information). The Company reports operating lease right-of-use assets in operating lease right-of-use assets and the current and non-current portions of its operating lease liabilities in accrued and other liabilities and non-current operating lease liabilities, respectively.</span> </p>
<p style="margin-top:9pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company&#8217;s finance leases consist primarily of satellite lifetime Ka-band capacity leases and have remaining terms from <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000809" name="vsat:FinanceLeaseRemainingLeaseTerm1" contextRef="C_0000797721_srtRangeAxis_srtMinimumMember_20190401_20191231" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen" continuedAt="C_c815bd3a-0acd-4608-aa22-84d77cdd7b21">one</ix:nonNumeric> to <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000810" name="vsat:FinanceLeaseRemainingLeaseTerm1" contextRef="C_0000797721_srtRangeAxis_srtMaximumMember_20190401_20191231" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">seven<ix:continuation id="C_c815bd3a-0acd-4608-aa22-84d77cdd7b21"> years</ix:continuation></ix:nonNumeric>. The Company reports assets obtained under finance leases in property, equipment and satellites, net and the current and non-current portions of its finance lease liabilities in current portion of long-term debt and other long-term debt, respectively.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;">&#160;</p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">24</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">VIASAT, INC.</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</p>

<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1.72%;">

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">$</p></td>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:1pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

</table></div></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:4pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Revolving Credit Facility </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:4pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">As of December&#160;31, 2019, the Revolving Credit Facility provided a $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000878" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityMaximumBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaapLineOfCreditMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">700.0</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million revolving line of credit (including up to $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000879" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityMaximumBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_us-gaapLetterOfCreditMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">150.0</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million of letters of credit), with a maturity date of <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000880" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityExpirationDate1" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaapLineOfCreditMember_20190401_20191231" format="ixt:datemonthdayyearen">January 18, 2024</ix:nonNumeric>. At December&#160;31, 2019, the Company had $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000881" name="us-gaap:LineOfCredit" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaapLineOfCreditMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">110.0</ix:nonFraction> million in principal amount of outstanding borrowings under the Revolving Credit Facility and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000882" name="us-gaap:LettersOfCreditOutstandingAmount" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_us-gaapLetterOfCreditMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">27.6</ix:nonFraction> million outstanding under standby letters of credit, leaving borrowing availability under the Revolving Credit Facility as of December&#160;31, 2019 of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000883" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityRemainingBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaapLineOfCreditMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">562.4</ix:nonFraction> million.</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000884" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityInterestRateDescription" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaapLineOfCreditMember_20190401_20191231">Borrowings under the Revolving Credit Facility bear interest, at the Company&#8217;s option, at either (1)&#160;the highest of the Federal Funds rate plus 0.50%, the Eurodollar rate plus 1.00%, or the administrative agent&#8217;s prime rate as announced from time to time, or (2)&#160;the Eurodollar rate, plus, in the case of each of (1)&#160;and (2), an applicable margin that is based on the Company&#8217;s total leverage ratio.</ix:nonNumeric> As of December&#160;31, 2019, the weighted average effective interest rate on the Company&#8217;s outstanding borrowings under the Revolving Credit Facility was <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000885" name="us-gaap:LongtermDebtWeightedAverageInterestRate" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaapLineOfCreditMember_20191231" decimals="4" scale="-2">3.28</ix:nonFraction>%. The Company has capitalized certain amounts of interest expense on the Revolving Credit Facility in connection with the construction of various assets during the construction period. The Revolving Credit Facility is required to be guaranteed by certain significant domestic subsidiaries of the Company (as defined in the Revolving Credit Facility) and secured by substantially all of the Company&#8217;s and any such subsidiaries&#8217; assets. As of December&#160;31, 2019, none of the Company&#8217;s subsidiaries guaranteed the Revolving Credit Facility. </p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">26</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">VIASAT, INC.</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(UNAUDITED)</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000400_dcnt_73782997-c0ef-434f-93c1-1868cf4f0796" continuedAt="F_000400_dcnt_8a6aef00-5afa-44c1-9a3b-071eb9d8d23b">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000886" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityDescription" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaapLineOfCreditMember_20190401_20191231">The Revolving Credit Facility contains financial covenants regarding a maximum total leverage ratio and a minimum interest coverage ratio. In addition, the Revolving Credit Facility contains covenants that restrict, among other things, the Company&#8217;s ability to sell assets, make investments and acquisitions, make capital expenditures, grant liens, pay dividends and make certain other restricted payments.</ix:nonNumeric> The Company was in compliance with its financial covenants under the Revolving Credit Facility as of December&#160;31, 2019.</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:13pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Ex-Im Credit Facility </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:4pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Ex-Im Credit Facility originally provided a $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000887" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityMaximumBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatExportImportCreditFacilityMember_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="6">362.4</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million senior secured direct loan facility, which was fully drawn. Of the $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000888" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityMaximumBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatExportImportCreditFacilityMember_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="6">362.4</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million in principal amount of borrowings made under the Ex-Im Credit Facility, $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000889" name="vsat:LineOfCreditFacilityMaximumBorrowingCapacityExcludingFinancingFees" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatExportImportCreditFacilityMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">321.2</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million was used to finance up to <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000890" name="vsat:LineOfCreditFacilityCapacityAvailableForSpecificPurposeOtherThanForTradePurchasesPercentage" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatExportImportCreditFacilityMember_20190401_20191231" decimals="2" scale="-2">85</ix:nonFraction>% of the costs of construction, launch and insurance of the ViaSat-2 satellite and related goods and services (including costs incurred on or after September&#160;18, 2012), with the remaining $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000891" name="vsat:LineOfCreditFacilityMaximumExposureFees" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatExportImportCreditFacilityMember_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="6">41.2</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million used to finance the total exposure fees incurred under the Ex-Im Credit Facility (which included all previously accrued completion exposure fees). As of December&#160;31, 2019, the Company had $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000892" name="us-gaap:LineOfCredit" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatExportImportCreditFacilityMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">117.9</ix:nonFraction> million in principal amount of outstanding borrowings under the Ex-Im Credit Facility. </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Borrowings under the Ex-Im Credit Facility bear interest at a fixed rate of <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000893" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateStatedPercentage" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatExportImportCreditFacilityMember_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="-2">2.38</ix:nonFraction>%, payable semi-annually in arrears. The effective interest rate on the Company&#8217;s outstanding borrowings under the Ex-Im Credit Facility, which takes into account timing and amount of borrowings and payments, exposure fees, debt issuance costs and other fees, is <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000896" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateEffectivePercentage" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatExportImportCreditFacilityMember_20191231" decimals="4" scale="-2">4.54</ix:nonFraction>%. Borrowings under the Ex-Im Credit Facility are required to be repaid in <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_vsatInstallment" id="F_000894" name="vsat:LineOfCreditFacilityRequiredNumberOfRepayments" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatExportImportCreditFacilityMember_20191231" decimals="INF">16</ix:nonFraction> semi-annual principal installments, which commenced on <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000897" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentDateOfFirstRequiredPayment1" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatExportImportCreditFacilityMember_20190401_20191231" format="ixt:datemonthdayyearen">April&#160;15, 2018</ix:nonNumeric>, with a maturity date of <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000895" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentMaturityDate" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatExportImportCreditFacilityMember_20190401_20191231" format="ixt:datemonthdayyearen">October&#160;15, 2025</ix:nonNumeric>. Pursuant to the terms of the Ex-Im Credit Facility, certain insurance proceeds related to the ViaSat-2 satellite must be used to pay down outstanding borrowings under the Ex-Im Credit Facility upon receipt. During the first three months of fiscal year 2020, the Company received the remaining insurance proceeds of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000898" name="us-gaap:ProceedsFromInsuranceSettlementInvestingActivities" contextRef="C_0000797721_20190401_20190630" decimals="-5" scale="6">2.3</ix:nonFraction> million, which were in addition to the $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000899" name="us-gaap:ProceedsFromInsuranceSettlementInvestingActivities" contextRef="C_0000797721_20180401_20190331" decimals="-5" scale="6">185.7</ix:nonFraction> million of insurance proceeds received in fiscal year 2019 related to the ViaSat-2 satellite, all of which were used to pay down outstanding borrowings under the Ex-Im Credit Facility upon receipt (see Note 1 &#8212; Basis of Presentation &#8211; Property, equipment and satellites for more information). The Ex-Im Credit Facility is guaranteed by Viasat and is secured by first-priority liens on the ViaSat-2 satellite and related assets, as well as a pledge of the capital stock of the borrower under the facility. </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000900" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityDescription" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatExportImportCreditFacilityMember_20190401_20191231">The Ex-Im Credit Facility contains financial covenants regarding Viasat&#8217;s maximum total leverage ratio and minimum interest coverage ratio. In addition, the Ex-Im Credit Facility contains covenants that restrict, among other things, the Company&#8217;s ability to sell assets, make investments and acquisitions, make capital expenditures, grant liens, pay dividends and make certain other restricted payments.</ix:nonNumeric> The Company was in compliance with its financial covenants under the Ex-Im Credit Facility as of December&#160;31, 2019. </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Borrowings under the Ex-Im Credit Facility are recorded as current portion of long-term debt and as other long-term debt, net of unamortized discount and debt issuance costs, in the Company&#8217;s condensed consolidated financial statements. The discount of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000901" name="vsat:CumulativeDebtInstrumentUnamortizedDiscountBeforeAmortization" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatExportImportCreditFacilityMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">42.3</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million (consisting of the initial $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000903" name="vsat:LineOfCreditFacilityExposureFeesPaid" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatExportImportCreditFacilityMember_20190401_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">6.0</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million pre-exposure fee, $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000902" name="vsat:ExposureFeesPrincipal" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatExportImportCreditFacilityMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">35.3</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million of completion exposure fees, and other customary fees) and deferred financing cost associated with the issuance of the borrowings under the Ex-Im Credit Facility are amortized to interest expense on an effective interest rate basis over the weighted average term of the Ex-Im Credit Facility and in accordance with the related payment obligations. </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:13pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Senior Notes </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:4pt;text-indent:0%;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Senior Secured Notes due 2027</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:4pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In March 2019, the Company issued $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000904" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentFaceAmount" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatTwoThousandAndTwentySevenNotesMember_20190331" decimals="-5" scale="6">600.0</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million in principal amount of 2027 Notes in a private placement to institutional buyers. The 2027 Notes were issued at face value and are recorded as long-term debt, net of debt issuance costs, in the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements. The 2027 Notes bear interest at the rate of <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000906" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateStatedPercentage" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatTwoThousandAndTwentySevenNotesMember_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="-2">5.625</ix:nonFraction>%&#160;per year, payable semi-annually in cash in arrears, which interest payments commenced in October 2019. Debt issuance costs associated with the issuance of the 2027 Notes are amortized to interest expense on a straight-line basis over the term of the 2027 Notes, the results of which are not materially different from the effective interest rate basis. </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The 2027 Notes are required to be guaranteed on a senior secured basis by each of the Company&#8217;s existing and future subsidiaries that guarantees the Revolving Credit Facility. As of December&#160;31, 2019, none of the Company&#8217;s subsidiaries guaranteed the 2027 Notes. The 2027 Notes are secured, equally and ratably with the Revolving Credit Facility and any future parity lien debt, by liens on substantially all of the Company&#8217;s assets. </p></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">27</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">VIASAT, INC.</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(UNAUDITED)</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000400_dcnt_8a6aef00-5afa-44c1-9a3b-071eb9d8d23b" continuedAt="F_000400_dcnt_79cbaa0b-c137-4e32-9f78-01ab61d58116">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The 2027 Notes are the Company&#8217;s general senior secured obligations and rank equally in right of payment with all of its existing and future unsubordinated debt. The 2027 Notes are effectively senior to all of the Company&#8217;s existing and future unsecured debt (including the 2025 Notes) as well as to all of any permitted junior lien debt that may be incurred in the future, in each case to the extent of the value of the assets securing the 2027 Notes. The 2027 Notes are effectively subordinated to any obligations that are secured by liens on assets that do not constitute a part of the collateral securing the 2027 Notes, are structurally subordinated to all existing and future liabilities (including trade payables) of the Company&#8217;s subsidiaries that do not guarantee the 2027 Notes (including obligations of the borrower under the Ex-Im Credit Facility), and are senior in right of payment to all of the Company&#8217;s existing and future subordinated indebtedness.</span></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The indenture governing the 2027 Notes limits, among other things, the Company&#8217;s and its restricted subsidiaries&#8217; ability to: incur, assume or guarantee additional debt&#59; issue redeemable stock and preferred stock&#59; pay dividends, make distributions or redeem or repurchase capital stock&#59; prepay, redeem or repurchase subordinated debt&#59; make loans and investments&#59; grant or incur liens&#59; restrict dividends, loans or asset transfers from restricted subsidiaries&#59; sell or otherwise dispose of assets&#59; enter into transactions with affiliates&#59; reduce the Company&#8217;s satellite insurance&#59; and consolidate or merge with, or sell substantially all of their assets to, another person. </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonNumeric <p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:3pt;text-indent:0%;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Senior Notes due 2025</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:4pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In September 2017, the Company issued $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000919" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentFaceAmount" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatTwoThousandAndTwentyFiveNotesMember_20170930" decimals="-5" scale="6">700.0</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million in principal amount of 2025 Notes in a private placement to institutional buyers. The 2025 Notes were issued at face value and are recorded as long-term debt, net of debt issuance costs, in the Company&#8217;s condensed consolidated financial statements. The 2025 Notes bear interest at the rate of <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000921" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateStatedPercentage" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatTwoThousandAndTwentyFiveNotesMember_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="-2">5.625</ix:nonFraction>%&#160;per year, payable semi-annually in cash in arrears, which interest payments commenced in March 2018. Debt issuance costs associated with the issuance of the 2025 Notes are amortized to interest expense on a straight-line basis over the term of the 2025 Notes, the results of which are not materially different from the effective interest rate basis. </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The 2025 Notes are required to be guaranteed on an unsecured senior basis by each of the Company&#8217;s existing and future subsidiaries that guarantees the Revolving Credit Facility. As of December&#160;31, 2019, none of the Company&#8217;s subsidiaries guaranteed the 2025 Notes. The 2025 Notes are the Company&#8217;s general senior unsecured obligations and rank equally in right of payment with all of the Company&#8217;s existing and future unsecured unsubordinated debt. The 2025 Notes are effectively junior in right of payment to the Company&#8217;s existing and future secured debt, including under the Credit Facilities and the 2027 Notes (to the extent of the value of the assets securing such debt), are structurally subordinated to all existing and future liabilities (including trade payables) of the Company&#8217;s subsidiaries that do not guarantee the 2025 Notes, and are senior in right of payment to all of the Company&#8217;s existing and future subordinated indebtedness. </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The indenture governing the 2025 Notes limits, among other things, the Company&#8217;s and its restricted subsidiaries&#8217; ability to: incur, assume or guarantee additional debt&#59; issue redeemable stock and preferred stock&#59; pay dividends, make distributions or redeem or repurchase capital stock&#59; prepay, redeem or repurchase subordinated debt&#59; make loans and investments&#59; grant or incur liens&#59; restrict dividends, loans or asset transfers from restricted subsidiaries&#59; sell or otherwise dispose of assets&#59; enter into transactions with affiliates&#59; reduce the Company&#8217;s satellite insurance&#59; and consolidate or merge with, or sell substantially all of their assets to, another person. </p></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">28</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">VIASAT, INC.</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(UNAUDITED)</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000400_dcnt_79cbaa0b-c137-4e32-9f78-01ab61d58116">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonNumeric decimals="INF" scale="-2">100</ix:nonFraction>%, in each case plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, thereon to the redemption date.</ix:nonNumeric> </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000933" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentRedemptionDescription" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapDebtInstrumentRedemptionPeriodAxis_vsatChangeOfControlMember_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatTwoThousandAndTwentyFiveNotesMember_20190401_20191231">In the event a change of control triggering event occurs (as defined in the indenture governing the 2025 Notes), each holder will have the right to require the Company to repurchase all or any part of such holder&#8217;s 2025 Notes at a purchase price in cash equal to <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000932" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentRedemptionPricePercentage" contextRef="C_0000797721_us-gaapDebtInstrumentRedemptionPeriodAxis_vsatChangeOfControlMember_us-gaapLongtermDebtTypeAxis_vsatTwoThousandAndTwentyFiveNotesMember_20190401_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="-2">101</ix:nonFraction>% of the aggregate principal amount of the 2025 Notes repurchased, plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, to the date of purchase (subject to the right of holders of record on the relevant record date to receive interest due on the relevant interest payment date).</ix:nonNumeric> <span style="font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;"> </span></p></ix:continuation>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000401" name="us-gaap:ProductWarrantyDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000797721_20190401_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:3pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Note 8 &#8212; Product Warranty </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:4pt;text-indent:4.54%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000426" name="us-gaap:StandardProductWarrantyPolicy" contextRef="C_0000797721_20190401_20191231" escape="true">The Company provides limited warranties on its products for periods of up to <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000934" name="vsat:ProductsWarrantyPeriodMaximum" contextRef="C_0000797721_20190401_20191231" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">five years</ix:nonNumeric>. The Company records a liability for its warranty obligations when products are shipped or they are included in long-term construction contracts based upon an estimate of expected warranty costs. Amounts expected to be incurred within 12 months are classified as accrued liabilities and amounts expected to be incurred beyond 12 months are classified as other liabilities in the condensed consolidated financial statements. For mature products, the warranty cost estimates are based on historical experience with the particular product. For newer products that do not have a history of warranty costs, the Company bases its estimates on its experience with the technology involved and the types of failures that may occur. It is possible that the Company&#8217;s underlying assumptions will not reflect the actual experience and, in that case, future adjustments will be made to the recorded warranty obligation.</ix:nonNumeric> <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000441" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfProductWarrantyLiabilityTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000797721_20190401_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000441_cnt_1">The following table reflects the change in the Company&#8217;s warranty accrual during the nine months ended December&#160;31, 2019 and 2018:</ix:nonNumeric> </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000441_cnt_1">

<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:15.92%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000940" name="us-gaap:StandardProductWarrantyAccrualPayments" contextRef="C_0000797721_20180401_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">2,889</ix:nonFraction></p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt transparent;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">)</p></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:61.06%; border-bottom:double 2.5pt transparent;">

<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1.52%; border-bottom:double 2.5pt transparent;">

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">$</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:15.92%; border-top:solid 0.75pt #000000; border-bottom:double 2.5pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000941" name="us-gaap:StandardProductWarrantyAccrual" contextRef="C_0000797721_20191231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">10,071</ix:nonFraction></p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1%; border-bottom:double 2.5pt transparent;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1%; border-top:solid 0.75pt #000000; border-bottom:double 2.5pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">$</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:15.92%; border-top:solid 0.75pt #000000; border-bottom:double 2.5pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000942" name="us-gaap:StandardProductWarrantyAccrual" contextRef="C_0000797721_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">7,007</ix:nonFraction></p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1%; border-bottom:double 2.5pt transparent;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:1pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
